channel.title: Mopar Classic Beta [Open!]
channel.description:
[quote="Moparisthebest, post:701, topic:392665"]Early beta is up here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/moparscape4.php?version=RSC&server=rsc.moparisthebest.com&port=43595&hash=none
Also authURL isn't enabled yet, so just login with any username and password. The server will automatically update when the pre-beta branch at github is committed to, so changes devs make will immediately show up on the server. Report bugs on github and submit pull requests with your fixes to get this up and running as fast as possible.[/quote]
@edit, works on windows now...

item.description:

[quote="-Nothing, post:217, topic:436508"]So is the ItemDef already cleaned out of the custom bullshit?[/quote]Yo.
Throw a point server up, need to pk.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Classic Beta [Open!]
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“mopman_sucks, post:213, topic:436508”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=539218.msg3992481#msg3992481 date=1336786870]

Why don’t you resolve the issue anyway and catch invalid items so the client doesn’t crash?
[/quote]Because without ::item it is literally impossible to get one, and therefore completely useless.

catch invalid items has nothing to do with removing the item command[/quote]That is the only way you can possibly get an invalid item…

Kryptix:

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=539218.msg3992481#msg3992481 date=1336786870]Because without ::item it is literally impossible to get one, and therefore completely useless.

It’s still a good idea to completely resolve the issue… What if someone accidentally adds the item to a drop or a shop or whatever. If you spawn an item on RSCE that doesn’t exist it catches it and does nothing.[/quote]Your hypothetical is based on someone being retarded, and is therefore invalid, because if they’re that retarded, what stops them from introducing other bug?

Also, shops and other such things already have that ‘protection’ seeing they get the item def. If it’s null (doesn’t exist), then it handles it accordingly.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Classic Beta [Open!]
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

CodeForFame:

Because without ::item it is literally impossible to get one, and therefore completely useless.

It’s still a good idea to completely resolve the issue… What if someone accidentally adds the item to a drop or a shop or whatever. If you spawn an item on RSCE that doesn’t exist it catches it and does nothing.

Read full topic

Right now if you use the command on an unknown item it won’t be a problem… invalid argument.

item.title: Mopar Classic Beta [Open!]
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

You found something we forgot about. Credits to you. Waj should get a beta reward. It came at the sacrifice of your account. Back to CFF statement… he is right. If their was no ::command, their would be no problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Classic Beta [Open!]
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:208, topic:436508”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=539218.msg3992224#msg3992224 date=1336753323]

The accounts are saved in temp flat files and will be switched over to sql for the official beta. You should just create a new account as mitb cbf to go edit the file.

And that means making a new mopar account and I cbf.

Simple as that really…I will stop trying to find the bugs if the owner is so lazy he can’t even fix my account. If his lazy already imagine how lazy his going to be when its up and running, just as I thought this has 100% turned to shit.
[/quote]No, that means typing in a different username…

The forums and game are not linked in any way, yet.

Also, it was your own stupidity that caused this… You shouldn’t have even tried to spawn a custom item. It’s shit like this that makes people not want to give players any commands or special abilities, even in beta.

BTW issues like this will not be possible, as there will be no possible way to get items that cause this bug when it goes live.

My stupidity? more like the fools who forgot to make sure the items xml match, If they had of made sure it matches my account would still work.[/quote]

No, by your own admission you were pretty sure that it would fuck shit up.

waj:

Basically I just had a feeling that it would make me crash and bug the account, so I just did ::item 1299 and well yeah the items xml don’t match.

Like I said, it’s from your own stupidity.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Classic Beta [Open!]
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“dexto, post:203, topic:436508”][quote author=waj link=topic=539218.msg3992140#msg3992140 date=1336735221]

Connection reset java.net.SocketException: Connection reset at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at mudclient.StreamClass.read(StreamClass.java:46) at mudclient.PacketConstruction.readByte(PacketConstruction.java:174) at mudclient.PacketConstruction.readShort(PacketConstruction.java:71) at mudclient.PacketConstruction.readLong(PacketConstruction.java:112) at mudclient.GameAppletMiddleMan.connect(GameAppletMiddleMan.java:44) at mudclient.mudclient.checkLoginScreenInputs(mudclient.java:3340) at mudclient.mudclient.checkInputs(mudclient.java:2457) at mudclient.GameApplet.run(GameApplet.java:305) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

External client works:
http://www.mediafire.com/?v54jgsxb8o4vhzh

That’s not a proper fix though is it.
[/quote]
Works for me xD
Will not use webclient.[/quote]
Its my account as I explained the first time I reported the bug, they might of fixed the xml files but clearly did not fix my account.

So either way, in my eyes the bug is still here as it effects my account.

Read full topic
